item.title: Meta AI can now understand and edit your photos
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
Meta announced that Meta AI will now be able to help you edit photos using AI technology as well as answer questions about the photos you share.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Meta AI’s genAI ‘Imagine’ features expand across Facebook, Instagram, and Messenger
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
With the update, users will be able to use prompts to generate AI photos directly in their feed, Stories, and for their Facebook profile pictures.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Meta lets businesses create ad-embedded chatbots
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Meta is now allowing businesses to create ads that, when clicked, bring up a chatbot customers can speak with about common topics.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Meta AI gets celebrity voices and lip-synced translations
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Meta is bringing a voice mode to its AI assistant, Meta AI, along with an Meta AI-powered translation feature for Instagram Reels.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Meta Connect 2024: Everything announced on AI, the metaverse, Quest headsets and more
item.dc:creator: Cody Corrall, Morgan Little
item.description:
Meta Connect 2024 is starting soon, and with it comes the expectation of reveals and updates to Meta’s latest AI model and metaverse ambitions. The developer-centric event will feature a keynote from CEO Mark Zuckerberg, during which he will likely showcase new hardware and software to support two of Meta’s big ambitions: AI and the […]

item.title: Meta discontinues Quest 2 and Quest Pro
item.dc:creator: Brian Heater
item.description:
With the budget Quest 3S now up for preorder, Meta will no longer sell the Quest 2 and Quest Pro once back stock is deleted.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Meta announces $300 Quest 3S, a cheaper take on mixed reality
item.dc:creator: Brian Heater
item.description:
The Meta Quest S3 is up for preorder Wednesday. It starts shipping October 15.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Diagrid launches Catalyst to help enterprises build their microservices
item.dc:creator: Frederic Lardinois
item.description:
Back in 2019, Microsoft launched Dapr, a new open-source project that made building event-driven distributed applications easier for developers. Like so many popular open-source projects, Dapr spawned its own ecosystem, especially after Microsoft donated it to the Linux Foundation. And as is also so often the case, some of the creators of Dapr — and […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Amazon employees beg management to reverse 5-day RTO mandate
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description:
Amazon CEO Andy Jassy announced to employees last week that they will be expected to work from the office five days a week, starting in 2025. Employees who have grown accustomed to a hybrid work structure are “strongly dissatisfied,” according to an anonymous survey created by Amazon employees. As Fortune reports, hundreds of employees responded […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Consumer, culture, and creators with Erin and Sara Foster at TechCrunch Disrupt 2024
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description:
Two of the industry’s most famous sisters, Erin and Sara Foster, sit down alongside business partner Phil Schwarz at TechCrunch Disrupt 2024 to talk about consumer investing, culture curation, and what it means to be a creator in the modern age.  Moderated on the Disrupt main stage, the conversation will surround the creator economy, consumer […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Longshot Space closes over $5M in new funding to build space gun in the desert
item.dc:creator: Aria Alamalhodaei
item.description:
Why use a rocket when you could use a giant, miles-long “gun” instead?  That’s the question posed by Longshot Space, a company that’s completely rethinking how to send mass to orbit. The company is developing a kinetic launch system that will gradually accelerate payloads to hypersonic speeds before launching them to orbit. While Longshot’s full-scale […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: After losing a peering lawsuit in Germany, Meta says it’s never getting back together with Deutsche Telekom
item.dc:creator: Ingrid Lunden
item.description:
Consumer apps can generate a lot of traffic and revenue, but some carriers have complained that they’re not getting a fair cut of the pie for carrying all that traffic across their network infrastructure. But if you were looking for a test case that demonstrated how the two sides might be able to work together, […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Ayrton Energy mimics margarine to store hydrogen safely
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description:
As the universe’s lightest gas, hydrogen is tricky to contain. But there’s an alternative: attaching hydrogen atoms to a carrier molecule that’s easier to move.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Meta’s Llama AI models get multimodal
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
At Meta Connect 2024, the company announced a new family of Llama models, Llama 3.2. It's somewhat multimodal.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Audible experiments with new AI features for tailored audiobook recommendations
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description:
Audible, the Amazon-owned audiobook service, continues to experiment with AI to improve audiobook discovery and offer customized recommendations. Recent tests involve AI-powered tags, which analyze customer feedback to offer tailored suggestions according to individual preferences, and topic pages that recommend tags to help you find closely related subjects. The experiments are only available to 50% […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Meta acquires the Threads.com domain name
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
Meta has acquired the Threads.com domain name, according to Whois records of the URL that were updated on September 24. Users on domain-related forums pointed out this transfer, and TechCrunch confirmed the Whois records of Threads.com separately, which list Meta’s Instagram as the registrant. TechCrunch reached out to Meta to understand if it plans to […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Early sign-ups to EU’s AI Pact include Amazon, Google, Microsoft, and OpenAI — but Apple and Meta are missing
item.dc:creator: Natasha Lomas
item.description:
The European Commission has revealed a list of the first 100-plus signatories to the AI Pact — an initiative focused on getting companies to publish “voluntary pledges” on how they approach and deploy artificial intelligence. While the bloc’s legally binding risk-based AI rulebook (the AI Act) entered into force last month, it will be several […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Final 3 days to score up to $600 in savings on TechCrunch Disrupt 2024 passes
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description:
Ticktock! The countdown is on to lock in your ticket for TechCrunch Disrupt 2024 at a huge discount. Save up to $600 on individual ticket types if you register before September 27 at 11:59 p.m. PT. Secure your spot before prices go up — this offer won’t last long Disrupt 2024 is your gateway to […]

item.title: Meta Connect 2024: How to watch the metaverse and generative AI event today
item.dc:creator: Brian Heater
item.description:
Meta Connect starts Wednesday at 10 a.m. PT and is set to focus on Meta's XR platforms, the metaverse, and its generative AI platform, Llama.

item.title: Google files antitrust complaint against Microsoft in Europe over cloud licensing practices
item.dc:creator: Paul Sawers
item.description:
Google has filed a complaint with the European Commission (EC), alleging that Microsoft uses anti-competitive licensing practices to strongarm companies into staying on its Azure cloud infrastructure. The complaint relates to a 2019 licensing change which made it more expensive to run Windows Server software on rival clouds. That change prompted European not-for-profit trade association Cloud Infrastructure […]
